snippet: At the National Museum of Afghanistan, the most important objects smashed by the Taliban have been reassembled, and looted treasures have also been returned.
abstract: National Museum of Afghanistan is thriving despite fact that 70 percent of its collection was destroyed or stolen in 2001 Taliban attack and subsequent looting; museum has restored three hundred of its most important objects and looted pieces have been returning in steady stream following smuggling crackdown by international law enforcement team.
lead_paragraph: At the National Museum of Afghanistan, the most important objects smashed by the Taliban have been reassembled, and looted treasures have also been returned.

headline.main: Saving Relics, Afghans Defy the Taliban
headline.print_headline: Saving Relics, Afghans Defy the Taliban
